meanings.definition: The areas outside of cities and towns, typically characterized by open land and natural scenery.
meanings.sent1: Many people enjoy taking peaceful walks in the countrysides.
meanings.sent2: Farmers work hard in the countrysides to grow crops and raise animals.
meanings.sent3: The cows in the countrysides have the best views!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast, unexplored countrysides of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting over the rolling hills painted a beautiful picture of the countrysides.

meanings.definition: The rural regions of a country, away from urban centers.
meanings.sent1: Small villages dot the countrysides, offering a quiet way of life.
meanings.sent2: People in the countrysides often have to travel long distances for supplies.
meanings.sent3: The sheep in the countrysides are the true rulers of the land!
meanings.sent4: His heart longed for the peaceful simplicity of the countrysides.
meanings.sent5: The sound of crickets at night filled the countrysides with a soothing melody.
